arts.ttl: Mark Robins' verdict as Lewis Baker grabs second chance at Stoke City
arts.sum: A cool penalty secured a vital point at Preston North End and means he has six goals for the Potters this season, despite spending half of it away. I wanted a little bit more from the wide areas and that is something we'll look for on Tuesday evening (at home against Luton Town, 7.45pm), and the rest of the season to be fair."

arts.ttl: Stoke player ratings vs Preston as Lewis Baker shows cool head in sea of nerves
arts.sum: Junho had a glorious chance to equalise when he had space at the back post but he was kept out by a combination of Cornell and Jordan Storey, with Stoke players appealing for a penalty as Baker curled a shot towards the top corner, where Cornell pushed over. Stoke started brightly and Million Manhoef was sent behind the Preston defence towards a one-on-one with Dai Cornell but he was struggling to get the ball under control quickly enough in a strong wind and he was cut out by Jordan Storey when it initially looked like a golden chance.

arts.ttl: Lewis Baker penalty earns Stoke deserved Deepdale draw against Preston
arts.sum: Kaine Kesler-Hayden had put North End ahead early on.

arts.ttl: Stoke City team news vs Preston as Mark Robins forced into one change
arts.sum: Wouter Burger and Lewis Baker join Thompson in midfield while it's a back four of Junior Tchamadeu, Eric Bocat, Ashley Phillips and Ben Wilmot in front of Viktor Johansson. Stoke: Johansson, Tchamadeu, Bocat, Phillips, Wilmot, Thompson, Burger, Baker, Manhoef, Junho, Gallagher.

arts.ttl: Preston North End vs Stoke City live - Team news from Deepdale - Stoke-on-Trent Live
arts.sum: It is still chaotic in the wrong half of the Championship and a mid-week win for Derby County over Preston at Pride Park has reminded all teams down there that there is plenty of time left and work to do to make sure they finish on the right side of the dreaded dotted line. Mark Robins has won his last two home matches but been dealt second-half injury-time sucker punches in his last two games on the road.

arts.ttl: Stoke City's 31 live TV games breakdown, lunchtime kick-offs, attendances and results
arts.sum: The 31st to be picked by Sky bosses was Stoke's final home game of the season, against Sheffield United, which has been moved from a Saturday afternoon to Friday, April 25 with an 9pm kick-off. Hats off to the 947 Stoke fans in the away end at Portsmouth on a Wednesday night in January when they could have watched at home, or the 800 at Bristol City, 900 at Sunderland or 900 at Southampton, as well as 360 for a Carabao Cup tie at Middlesbrough on a Tuesday evening and 894 at Carlisle.

arts.ttl: and I want to see one thing from Stoke City players
arts.sum: We probably need eight points or so from the last seven games and at Preston – who had a tough cup game last Sunday and a mid-week match at Derby – I want to see the Stoke players hit the levels they reached for last weekend’s win over Queens Park Rangers. It was the system we’re after, with a sitting midfielder linking with two centre-backs and goalkeeper as the base of your spine; another midfielder who can sit in if needed with that but can also push forward and has short and long-range passing vision and awareness; another midfielder who can join in with the forward player and can work the ball through central areas – and has a long shot on him too.

arts.ttl: Next step set out for Stoke City full-back to reach potential
arts.sum: Stoke City coaches will continue to work with Eric Bocat and Junior Tchamadeu about decision making as the full-back pair show their potential when they get things right. “The pair of them are really good in a number of ways and I still think they can improve decision making.

arts.ttl: Stoke City predicted XI vs Preston North End as Mark Robins makes demand
arts.sum: Stoke City will be cheered on by a 4,000-strong away following at Preston North End as Mark Robins tells his players to ‘put in a performance they can really get behind’. I’ve asked for their unwavering support and really we know they love the club and just want to see that and feel it from the players.

arts.ttl: Stoke City injuries not forgotten in resolve to fix long-term scourge
arts.sum: If impact injuries come with the territory, some muscle problems might be avoidable and there seemed to be a difference of opinion about training expectations and diaries, which deepened in pre-season. It is not the first time that Stoke have a problem like this - and if all clubs bemoan injuries at some point it has happened too much to be put down as bad luck or coincidence.
